subject: Sales
title: Why Likability Closes Deals
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Likability Closes Deals.

hook.text: Two identical proposals. Same price, same scope. The buyer picks the seller they like. Always.

buildup.text: Cialdini calls it the liking principle. We say yes to people we genuinely enjoy being around.

discovery.text: Likability isn't charm. It's warmth, curiosity, and finding something honestly in common.

twist.text: Forced friendliness repels. Buyers spot a fake connection from across the room.

climax.text: True likability means caring about the buyer's outcome more than your own commission.

punchline.text: Be the person buyers want to say yes to.

quiz.question: What is Cialdini's 'liking principle'?
options: People say yes to those they enjoy
